p: The total phenolic and flavonoid contents in C. latifolia and C. orchioides varied depend on their harvest time, the origin of growth location, and the plant parts. The total phenolics compounds are all accumulated in the rhizomes part of plants. In this study, the total phenolic and flavonoid contents in RLSP, RLSB, and RLSK of C. latifolia samples are affected by its altitude. Its soil nutrient condition might influence the phenolic content in all C. latifolia samples, the soil moisture (microclimate), and the harvest time. RLSB and RLSK samples were harvested during the monsoon season and contained higher phenolic compound contents than the RLSP sample, which was harvested during the drought season.
